1.text: Hear this, O ye priests, and hearken, O house of Israel, and give ear, O house of the king; for unto you pertaineth the judgment; for ye have been a snare at Mizpah, and a net spread upon Tabor.

2.text: And the revolters are gone deep in making slaughter; but I am a rebuker of them all.

3.text: I know Ephraim, and Israel is not hid from me; for now, O Ephraim, thou hast played the harlot, Israel is defiled.

4.text: Their doings will not suffer them to turn unto their God; for the spirit of whoredom is within them, and they know not Jehovah.

5.text: And the pride of Israel doth testify to his face: therefore Israel and Ephraim shall stumble in their iniquity; Judah also shall stumble with them.

6.text: They shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek Jehovah; but they shall not find him: he hath withdrawn himself from them.

7.text: They have dealt treacherously against Jehovah; for they have borne strange children: now shall the new moon devour them with their fields.

8.text: Blow ye the cornet in Gibeah, and the trumpet in Ramah: sound an alarm at Beth-aven; behind thee, O Benjamin.

9.text: Ephraim shall become a desolation in the day of rebuke: among the tribes of Israel have I made known that which shall surely be.

10.text: The princes of Judah are like them that remove the landmark: I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.

11.text: Ephraim is oppressed, he is crushed in judgment; because he was content to walk after manâ€™s command.

12.text: Therefore am I unto Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.

13.text: When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah saw his wound, then went Ephraim to Assyria, and sent to king Jareb: but he is not able to heal you, neither will he cure you of your wound.

14.text: For I will be unto Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the house of Judah: I, even I, will tear and go away; I will carry off, and there shall be none to deliver.

15.text: I will go and return to my place, till they acknowledge their offence, and seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me earnestly.
